FacilityName: Odom's Tennessee Pride - Little Rock, AR

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Facility Name: Odom's Tennessee Pride - Little Rock, AR

EPA ID 1000 0003 9781

_________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________



1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policy: ConAgra Foods maintains a

comprehensive safety, health, and environmental program at the plant. The program includes engineering,

education, and enforcement provisions for hazard communication, spill prevention and response, hazardous

waste, universal waste and waste oil management, waste water and storm water management.



2. Emergency Response Program: ConAgra Foods facility has developed an OSHA hazardous substance

emergency action plan. The plan outlines specific procedures for evacuations, incident alarms and alerting.

Depending upon a given situation, the Fire Department will be called to provide back-up emergency responders

and equipment. The Fire Department will be called for all fire related emergencies. The facility has

communicated hazard of propane with the local fire department and LEPC. The incident commander has

ultimate control of implementation of the emergency response plan.



3. Stationary Source and Regulated Substance: ConAgra Foods is a processing plant located at 4701 Asher

Avenue, Little Rock AR. The main building houses a processing plant used for manufacturing of raw and

cooked pork sausage. The products require refrigeration for the processing and freezing associated with the

products.



4. Worst Case and Alternative Release Scenarios: RMP*Comp was used to calculate the worst case and

alternative release scenarios for the process.



5. Five Year Accident History: There have been no reportable incidents during the past five years. However,

the facility maintains records of all incident investigation reports regardless of propane quantity released into the

atmosphere.



6. Planned changes to improve safety: Based on the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) for anhyd

rous

ammonia, lists of action items were developed. The status of these action items will be monitored to ensure

that implementation of the safety improvements is accomplished. Monthly Safety training is conducted for all

team members at this facility, in addition PSM meetings are held to review safety and PSM program elements.

Refer to Process Safety Management Program for specific information.
